column1: The ongoing COVID-19 pandemic has made the important contributions our first responders make in every community across the United States clearer than ever.   I was proud to partner with @RepRalphNorman to give our first repsonders the recognition they deserve. https://t.co/H8Ft6AkCxg

The President’s failure to acknowledge the reality of COVID-19 has resulted in the deaths of nearly 250K Americans including over 11K folks right here in Illinois.   His failure to acknowledge the reality of this election could handicap the next admin and further this suffering. https://t.co/7wzc8Y4Fo8

We just kicked off our free COVID Testing in Englewood! Come out to 1316 W 63rd Street and get tested! We are here until 4pm. All ages are welcome individuals under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian. https://t.co/ulwHbCXNvw

#COVID19 has made it clearer than ever that everyone needs reliable high-speed broadband. Today the #TrumpFCC doubled down on repealing #NetNeutrality. If you agree that internet access should be a right not a privilege join us in fighting to restore a free & open internet. https://t.co/aRoi4FNV79

Pleased to report that @HHSGov responded to my letter by reversing Sept 19th guidance that could have forced many safety net hospitals to return critically needed COVID relief funds. I will never stop working to protect safety net hospitals in my district. https://t.co/XShEH87JKn

I am pleased to join @RepDavid @MikeKellyPA and @RepThompson in introducing the START Act. At-home testing is key to ensuring those exposed to COVID-19 and particularly seniors receive timely treatment and prevent the spread to others. https://t.co/ojzVin7pLf

COVID-19 created unprecedented disruptions in our medical community. Our healthcare providers have been on the frontline adjusting to new challenges and providing critical care to patients. Now is not the time for reimbursement cuts to specialists. https://t.co/K6o8LnBtX2

We’re delivering #ForThePeople. But @senatemajldr is standing in the way because of special interests. With COVID threatening lives & livelihoods and people across the country standing up against racism the stakes are higher than ever https://t.co/HKR3R4QISE
This is a grim milestone.  We must do a better job of preventing the spread of #COVID19.  We need a national strategy that includes face masks and testing and tracing.  https://t.co/zvwSDe8q43
This is even more true in the era of #COVID19.  The US has hit 200000 deaths.  Access to health care has always been important but is even more so now. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/Q4Bg6G2mYE

This is what happens when you spend over six months lying to the American people about the seriousness of this pandemic.   1206 Americans died from COVID-19 yesterday. This President is killing us. https://t.co/KSXqQD6Tj2

Are you looking for the latest information on #COVID19? On September 17 medical experts from @NUFeinbergMed   will be available to share the latest data about COVID-19 and measures older adults can take to prepare for Fall/Winter. More info here & below: https://t.co/JIy8AnSquh https://t.co/ZD2IzDoubZ

This is disturbing but not the least bit surprising especially considering that a number of Republican Senators were caught quietly dumping stocks after being briefed on COVID-19 but loudly assuring the American public that U.S. was prepared to face this public health crisis. https://t.co/a9c6iqivqs https://t.co/b4hHXI5gTI

A good place to start would be with my bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act which would provide $100 Billion for local organizations to conduct door-to-door testing and outreach nationwide. https://t.co/ie7XjJ2RiC
The President is deliberately putting his own supporters’ lives at risk for the sake of his own ego.   Reminder: Herman Cain died from COVID-19 after attending a Trump rally. https://t.co/bYqbiFWTmo
Nearly 200000 Americans have perished due to COVID-19 and the President is spending his morning tweeting about the TV ratings. https://t.co/w0zU1yHfP9

This #LaborDay we remember all those who have fought and continue to fight tirelessly for workers’ rights in the streets and on the picket line.   @HouseDemocrats will continuing fighting for American workers—especially during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/V8tQOWUbam

In case you forget about @RepThomasMassie he is the same person who drove overnight from Kentucky to DC in order to delay a vote on critical coronavirus funding back in March. https://t.co/nh8QVCKsB1 https://t.co/fZBYkTYaR4

Will County has set aside more than $24 million for Small Business Assistance Grants in order to provide financial assistance to small businesses impacted by #COVID19.   Selected businesses may receive up to $15000 in grant assistance. More info here: https://t.co/YlTyghhn5Z

COVID-19 has devastated our nation and put millions out of work. The energy sector alone has lost over 1.3  million jobs.  @Energy Sec. Brouillette’s commitment to this report is essential to energy sector recovery and bringing back clean energy jobs for hard-working Americans. https://t.co/DhIicVTWrf

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! Our nation is experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/EcvHx5XJEm

Amidst a pandemic that has killed over 180000 Americans this President is holding an illegal political rally on the White House lawn with ZERO social distancing and little to no masks.   Remember: Herman Cain died after contracting COVID-19 at a Trump Rally. https://t.co/52eOme180K

“We need to be able to do very quick tracing and testing and have that infrastructure up and ready to go.”  — @ASlavitt  My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act and its Senate companion by @SenAngusKing would provide this infrastructure so we can fight this pandemic AND future ones. https://t.co/dwp8UA2Vxq

Black women are more likely to be on the front lines during the #COVID19 pandemic but continue to be paid less than their white male counterparts.  We must stop taking Black women for granted and start paying them what they deserve. #BlackWomensEqualPay https://t.co/s659oNvS9J

Black Americans and other communities of color are being absolutely devastated by #COVID19.  That’s why I joined @JoaquinCastrotx and @RepCardenas in urging Congressional leadership to prioritize the needs of communities being disproportionately impacted by this dreaded disease. https://t.co/kaj23JEdfh

If you’ve been unable to pay your mortgage due to #COVID19 the Illinois Housing Development Authority is offering emergency mortgage assistance. Funds are limited so complete your application as soon as possible.   More information can be found here: https://t.co/0IVu6ydtem
1000 Americans are dying every day due to COVID-19. Nearly 160000 Americans have lost their lives.   The President’s response?  “It is what it is.” https://t.co/93R198QN36
It's called COVID-19 and he caught it at your rally @realDonaldTrump.  Another American dead due to your utter incompetence. https://t.co/0Z4FBmTu6V

Absolutely despicable. Countless Black prisoners are effectively being sentenced to death due to COVID-19 and unsuitable prison conditions while Trump's former fixer gets to serve the rest of his sentence in his slippers. https://t.co/B1NIeZB4Cr

FREE COVID-19 testing is being provided within the City of @chicago. However at this time testing is limited in to people who meet certain screening criteria.   Click here for more information: https://t.co/zoiuqoWPnS

.@FERC’s reckless gutting of PURPA is wholly irresponsible especially when COVID-19 threatens clean energy accessibility affordability and jobs.   American families need solutions but this decision only creates problems. Nevertheless my commitment to address them holds firm. https://t.co/rVPU5IV0Sm

The cover-up continues! First it was his crimes now it’s the coronavirus.   This President may try to conceal COVID-19 data but we will not forget the nearly 140000 Americans who have died as a direct result of his incompetence. https://t.co/B7Q3XU71ZU

Nearly 140000 Americans have died from COVID-19 due to this President’s incompetence and he’s spending his time promoting a private company from the Oval Office.   Absolutely disgraceful. https://t.co/5ui4EH7bzr

We cannot afford to become comfortable or complacent.  Please stay home if you are able. If you must leave your home wear a mask and maintain social distance. This virus isn’t going anywhere anytime soon so we must remain vigilant if we are going to defeat this dreaded disease. https://t.co/8QBn1HG9Si

Who to believe? One of the most trusted medical figures in the U.S. and Director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases since 1984 or the proven liar who suggested we *inject disinfectant* to kill the coronavirus. 🤔   #IBelieveDrFauci https://t.co/kkgGX3I0C6
Wear a Mask. 😷 Maintain Social Distance. 🧍‍♀️↔️🧍 AND  WASH👏YOUR👏HANDS👏👏👏 https://t.co/5vp5g97r6V

July is National Minority Mental Month Awareness Month and as we recognize the disproportionate impact COVID-19 is having on minority communities we must not overlook the impact this pandemic is having on our mental health.   For more info please visit: https://t.co/K9N7hjOi2l

As Chairman of the Energy Subcomittee I look forward to questioning the Secretary on DOE’s response to the COVID-19 pandemic given the historic job losses being suffered by the energy sector and what he is doing to ensure a more diverse clean energy workforce. https://t.co/aiXPJ2wWer

Slowing down and/or eliminating testing isn’t going to make COVID-19 go away.   @realDonaldTrump and his administration must continue to fund critically needed testing sites in Illinois and beyond if we are ever going to get back to normal. https://t.co/Q7VVHuDlZc

A new report published in the @royalsociety Open Science found that weekly testing w/ household quarantine and contact tracing would probably end the epidemic.   My bill the COVID-19 TRACE act would provide $100 Billion to undertake this critical effort. https://t.co/4MLAm37GmK

One way to address these disparities is increased testing and contact tracing in medically undeserved areas.   Admiral Brett P. Giroir of @HHSGov agreed that we would need BILLIONS of dollars to conduct such efforts. My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act would provide $100 billion. https://t.co/eSaxAf7OCL

Dr. Fauci also noted that institutional racism presents a "double whammy" for the Black community when it comes to COVID-19.  Black Americans are more likely to be essential workers increasing their risk of exposure and more likely to have pre-existing conditions. https://t.co/Hta3vU655x

During today's @EnergyCommerce Hearing on the Trump Administration's COVID-19 response I asked Dr. Anthony Fauci whether racism itself was a contributing factor in the disproportionate suffering & death currently being experienced by the black community.   His answer: Yes. https://t.co/e87xDu1YOp

Millions of Americans are struggling to pay rent due to COVID-19. My bill the Ensuring HOMES Act would offer forgivable federal loans to landlords who waive rent & extend leases during the pandemic.   The legislation is supported by @Suntimes & @LISC_HQ. https://t.co/U5hNbsSjFS

The one silver lining of this pandemic is we have an opportunity to effect monumental change to problems that have plagued our communities for too long.   NOW is the time to take decisive actions to address BOTH the coronavirus AND the underlying social determinants of health.

FINALLY we must ensure that African-Americans are better represented in clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccines and treatments. This means we must continue to fight against misinformation AND ensure that the current administration ensures equal access. https://t.co/YHM6U8UYoq

SECOND on top of increasing testing we must also confront the lack of doctors in medically underserved areas .   My bill the COMMUNITIES Act would address this inequity which we discussed during yesterday's critical @EnergyCommerce hearing on racial disparities in #COVID19. https://t.co/HulHWZcHZY

I was proud to see my colleagues bat down these conspiracy theories so we could focus on the substance of the bill: protecting communities disproportionately impacted by the coronavirus. https://t.co/ZzUiYh73Fh

Sadly this bill was the target of the same misinformation mentioned earlier. The same forces that once claimed black folks were immune to COVID-19 proceeded to spread outright falsehoods about a bill designed to help Black Americans. See the pattern? https://t.co/22rEYf5PWH

FIRST we must pass legislation to help the Black community (and other medically underserved communities) combat the coronavirus. My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act would increase testing & outreach efforts in communities hit hardest by coronavirus. https://t.co/R4hRV9KW4X

In the early days of COVID-19 there were many online — even verified accounts on this platform — who dangerously claimed that black people were "immune" to the #coronavirus further endangering the lives of an already vulnerable community. https://t.co/81U3g8h5jY

If we are to ensure the full recovery of the energy sector from the COVID-19 pandemic we must make bold investments in our energy infrastructure and workforce as was done both during the Great Depression and the Great Recession. https://t.co/yuJCtVCzQE

Today the @EnergyCommerce Subcommittee on Energy held a hearing to examine the impact of COVID-19 on one of our nation’s most essential sectors.  To date the energy sector has lost a total of 1.3 million jobs with the clean-energy industry losing over 600000 jobs since March. https://t.co/N6cZCVbVc9

Today at 12:00 pm ET the @EnergyCommerce Subcommittee on Energy will hold a hearing on COVID-19’s impact on the energy sector and what we can do to help this sector recover and ultimately revive our economy.   Please tune in here: https://t.co/2lTEUQ5VEf

The President is not a Dictator and we will not sit idly be as he attempts to “dominate” the people of Illinois.   If @realDonaldTrump would like to help the people of my state/district he should send us more PPE for our essential workers & increase COVID-19 testing nationwide. https://t.co/wndehMTpI4
108000 Americans have died from COVID-19 due to this Administration’s incompetence and this President has the audacity to (falsely) accuse someone else of murder. https://t.co/ijWec6x5WB

Voting by mail is necessary for the President but “a very dangerous thing” for the rest of us.   Regular coronavirus testing is necessary for @WhiteHouse staff but ”nonsensical” for everyone else.   See the pattern? https://t.co/Tx3pGw17Wr
Today at 3:40 PM CT I will be joining @KatyTurNBC on @MSNBC to discuss coronavirus the importance of contact tracing and my bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act.   See you then! https://t.co/JMLLyOe3lz

What the @GOP fails to realize—or chooses to ignore—is that much of the suffering caused by COVID-19 is due to the systemic failures of a number of U.S. institutions especially when we examine how our healthcare system has utterly failed the black community amid this pandemic. https://t.co/XOWSLTlJQf

Thank you @RepAndreCarson for taking the time to address the falsehoods being spread about the COVID-19 TRACE Act.   As Rep. Carson points out the TRACE Act is about providing folks with the resources they need to combat this dreaded disease. https://t.co/JtMnIrqt5L

Earlier today I was joined by @SenatorDurbin & @RepRobinKelly to visit the @UIHealth’s Mile Square South Shore testing facility.   We must continue to increase testing in communities that are being hardest hit by #COVID19 if we are ever going to get back to normal. https://t.co/02K10QVZEa

My bill the Martha Wright Prison Phone Justice Act passed the House as part of the #HeroesAct this past Friday. This critical legislation ensures that families and incarcerated family members are able to stay connected during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/YfQ7qvfz1N

Last week I spoke with CBS Chicago about my bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act & discussed the need for increased testing & tracing in communities most impacted by the #coronavirus.  I also emphasized the importance of hiring tracers from our own communities. https://t.co/R4hRV9KW4X

Absolutely. We must increase testing nationwide especially in communities of color & other medically underserved areas.  My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act would accomplish this through a $100 BILLION grant program for community based organizations to ramp up testing. https://t.co/Yz1X9gQZXl
Nearly 90000 Americans have died from COVID-19 but please show us your Star Trek flag. https://t.co/YU4J2giAyt

Without increased testing & contact tracing—especially in hotspots & medically underserved communities—we will never be able to safely reopen society.  That’s why I introduced the #COVID19 TRACE Act. This bipartisan legislation is key if we are ever going to get back to normal. https://t.co/fgezkWhnQQ

Thank you Jason.   The COVID-19 TRACE Act is about getting testing to the communities that need it most. As many scientists/experts have pointed out the only way we will get back to normal is by ramping up testing & increasing our contact tracing efforts. My bill does both. https://t.co/FKDyaSMUeq

The COVID-19 TRACE Act would not authorize removing #coronavirus patients from their homes or require testing.  This bill is about providing testing and outreach to communities that are being hit the hardest by this deadly disease.  https://t.co/pIXXJmL85v

My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act would bring much needed resources to the black community and other medically underserved communities that have been the hardest hit by this dreaded disease. https://t.co/5qqptnO6LM

We are witnessing more testing in white communities but more COVID-19 cases/deaths in black communities. We must bring more testing to the medically underserved to stop this trend—the COVID-19 TRACE Act does just that.  Read my op-ed w/ @AmDiabetesAssn: https://t.co/lRsDfSPl3A

I’m glad to see that my bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act was the most-viewed bill on https://t.co/KSQs8lQr6N last week. We MUST increase testing especially in communities that have been most impacted by the COVID-19.  My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act would provide $100 BILLION in grants for local organizations to run mobile testing units to ensure everyone who wants a test can get tested. https://t.co/ERwTKyQvbQ

I look forward to joining @SantitaJ this morning to discuss the importance of my bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act which would increase testing and outreach efforts for communities most impacted by the coronavirus.   More testing is the only way we will SAFELY get back to normal. https://t.co/2L4UJF6OR4

We cannot safely reopen our country and return to normal without more robust testing and contact tracing. Period.   My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act will provide the funding needed for organizations at the state & local level to safely carry out such testing and outreach efforts. https://t.co/Ag9IFQSNj6

In order to save lives... the United States must implement a robust and comprehensive system to identify all COVID-19 cases...  That's exactly why I introduced the COVID-19 TRACE Act so that we can safely reopen our economy and get back to normal! https://t.co/V5bDn1YQRb

“... nothing in the bill could remotely bring about what some online are fretting over.”  COVID-19 is disproportionately killing black folks. My bill is about increasing testing for minorities & other medically underserved communities. I wonder why the right is so against it? 🤔

@BillyReedPoet Thank you for your question Billy. The answer is absolutely not. The COVID-19 TRACE Act will simply make it easier to receive testing by allowing for mobile testing and door-to-door outreach as is safe and necessary.   Nobody will be forced to be tested/removed under this bill.

The @CDCgov says contact tracing is a “core disease control measure” & “key strategy for preventing further spread of COVID-19.”  The COVID-19 TRACE Act would allow for mobile testing & door-to-door outreach to ensure we can SAFELY get back to normal. https://t.co/YlYhCQA5rR

Rep. Underwood is right. That is why I encourage all members to support my bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act which would create a $100 BILLION grant program for local organizations to hire train and pay individuals to operate mobile testing units and conduct contact tracing. https://t.co/AbhvrGcAwe

Thank you @ASlavitt.  The COVID-19 TRACE Act would provide $100 BILLION in grants for local organizations to hire train and pay individuals to run mobile testing units and conduct much needed contact tracing. I encourage more of my colleagues to cosponsor this legislation. https://t.co/JFULBO8Y8s

This thread shows why we need mobile testing and door-to-door outreach if we are going to be able to test a significant portion of the population.  My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act creates a $100 billion grant program to ramp up mobile testing and contact tracing. https://t.co/CWLMbu3KQO

Absolutely. My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act (H.R. 6666) would create a $100 BILLION grant program for local organizations to hire train and pay individuals to operate mobile testing units and conduct contact tracing in hot spots and medically underserved areas. https://t.co/5YGK34ifsU

This is exactly why we need widespread nationwide testing AND contact tracing. My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act (H.R. 6666) provides $100 billion dollars in grant funding for both. https://t.co/CQayarI6r9

I agree. My bill the COVID-19 TRACE Act (H.R. 6666) would create a $100 billion grant program to locally hire individuals in order to fully mobilize our contact tracing efforts.  Widespread testing and contact tracing is the only way to safely reopen the economy. https://t.co/c9HB1GgEMc

Just finished an E&C briefing w/ CDC regarding racial disparities & COVID-19 which I have been calling for since late last month.  I’m glad to see the agency is taking this seriously & look forward to continuing to work w/ them on addressing these disparities & contact tracing.
